result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine M Reins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Probation may transfer to Indiana.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with current Walworth County sentences.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
------------------

No contact with S.T.S. other than incidental at the jail.
------------------

Obtain and maintain full time employment or school, or combination of both.
------------------

Absolute sobriety. Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
------------------
AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
See count #2.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count #2, and current Walworth County Sentences.

Defendant Christine M Reins in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Christine M Reins.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing - **SEE ATTACHED PLEA AGREEMENT**
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment
Elements & Joint Recommendation
Notice of Post Conviction Rights
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Invocation of Right to Counsel
Service by DA #22-797, $80.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.T.S. OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL AT THE JAIL. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

1:30pm Court in session

Defendant Christine Reins present in court, in custody via video with attorney Steven Spear who appears via telephone. ADA Andrew Herrmann present in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Record by Atty Spear, he was just appointed on this case & has a conflict with the original court dates.
Speedy demand was made by Deft on 8/22

Parties have been in negotiations, Atty Spear needs to speak with Deft about potential resolution
Discussion between the parties as to speedy demand timeline, ADA Herrmann motions the Court to amend the bond to a signature bond & that would eliminate the time constraints

Atty Spear asks to add to a 1:15 call in about 10 days in hopes it will be a plea/sentencing

Bond amended to signature bond

1:35pm Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Deft - Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Defendant Christine M Reins in court.  Attorney Grace Hagerman in court for Christine M Reins.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:54 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance. Record by Atty. Hagerman that they are asking for speedy trial dates. Court addresses preliminary hearing/arraignment before trial dates can be set. Response by Atty Hagerman that defendant is prepared to waive preliminary hearing today.
Court goes over waiver form with the Defendant and finds waiver of preliminary hearing to be freely, knowing, and intelligent.
Not guilty plea entered by Atty. Hagerman.
Matter set for speedy trial before assigned Judge - KOSS.
Court in recess.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH S.T.S. OTHER THAN INCIDENTAL AT THE JAIL. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Christine Reins in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner for defendant. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
